name: 黃玲媛
objective:
The course surveys the principles of chemistry and properties of matter which interest the engineers most. It will place more emphasis on conceptual understanding. It is designed to provide the electro-optical engineering major the background in modern chemistry that students need to serve their professional interests.
Course Outline:
1. Chemical Stoichiometry: Calculations with Chemical Formulas
2. Chemical Stoichiometry: Calculations with Chemical Equations
3. Aqueous Reactions and Solution Stoichiometry
4. Thermochemistry
5. Molecular Geometry and Bonding Theories
6. Intermolecular Forces; Some Properties of Liquids; Phase Changes; Vapor Pressure; Phase Diagrams
7. Structures of Solids; Bonding in Solids
8. Modern Materials
